result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler M. Ladwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes: conditions of probation costs $443.00   Def. to get an HSED or GED.    AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations   Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.

miscConds.notes: $443.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Def. to get an HSED or GED.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler M. Ladwig in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties,  stipulate to facts, DEF pleads NC to CT#2 found guilty, CT#1 dismiss and read-in.
Court withholds sentence  on CT#2, 1 year probation conditions of probation costs $443.00   Def. to get an HSED or GED.    AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations   Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.

Combined 15CT17 and 15CM101
Standard STOP Program Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
  
May not be on the premises of any establishment that serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a stop case manager (715-638-3317) for the purpose of setting up a procedure to monitor compliance with the bond provisions.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.

Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.

Defendant Tyler M. Ladwig in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court cancels warrant.   Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint. Pleads Not Guilty to charges.  Court orders $500 signature bond, combined with 15CT17.   Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.
